6Although this view is named after the 19th century economist David Ricardo who first explored the possible relationship, the seminal work on this theory is Robert Barro, "Are Government Bonds Net Wealth?"
20A nonsaver could get lucky and receive an inheritance or win the lottery.

According to a 1999 opinion survey, low and moderate income Americans mistakenly believe they have a better chance of accumulating $500,000 through winning the lottery than through saving and investing a portion of their income.

Or, the replacement rate considered to be adequate can be computed in a more sophisticated way, netting out Social Security taxes, other taxes, or working expenses that will not be paid in retirement.

Or, the replacement rate considered to be adequate can be computed in a more sophisticated way, netting out Social Security taxes, other taxes, or working expenses that will not be paid in retirement.

Increasing national saving is an important way to bolster retirement security for current workers and to allow future workers to more easily bear the costs of financing federal retirement and health programs while maintaining their standard of living.

Or, the replacement rate considered to be adequate can be computed in a more sophisticated way, netting out Social Security taxes, other taxes, or working expenses that will not be paid in retirement.
The way in which Social Security is reformed will influence both the magnitude and timing of any increase in national saving.

Although unified budget surpluses increase national saving available for private investment, increasing federal spending on infrastructure, if properly designed and administered, can be another way to increase national saving and investment.

Or, the replacement rate considered to be adequate can be computed in a more sophisticated way, netting out Social Security taxes, other taxes, or working expenses that will not be paid in retirement.
Data converted to 2000 dollars using the consumer price index for all urban consumers.
The 1996 welfare reform law allowed states to use Temporary Assistance for Needy Family (TANF) funds to establish subsidized saving accounts for TANF recipients.

So far, the federal government has used surplus funds to reduce its debt held by the public.
